item.title: Remembering the Original Sahara Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Icon
item.description:
A Desert Dream Takes Shape: The Sahara’s Debut

Before the mega-resorts and dazzling spectacles we associate with the Las Vegas Strip today, there was the Sahara Hotel and Casino. Opening its doors on October 7, 1952, it represented a pivotal moment in Las Vegas’s burgeoning casino era. As the sixth resort to grace the Strip, the Sahara, sprawling across 20 acres, quickly carved out its own distinct identity – a vibrant, themed oasis far removed from the dusty desert landscape. With 240 rooms, each boasting a patio or balcony, and a workforce of 500, it was a significant undertaking.
